Properties.Description: Allows IDs to be less than 2000 if this isn't the vanilla bundle.
Indicates an item on the Steam Marketplace.
The GameObject name of the item when held or spawned in-game. By default this is the @ID of the item but may be changed for sharing animations.
The type of item to create.
Indicates how rare the item is, which influences it's name's color.
Instructs the item icon generator to use the item's ID to lookup an icon instead of it's @GUID or special path.
The width in tiles of the item in the inventory.
The height in tiles of the item in the inventory.
Overrides the orthoganal size of the camera that captures the item icon. This is half of the vertical height of the camera's view.
Enables automatic icon zoom measurement instead of using @Size_Z for icon zoom.
Overrides the orthoganal size of the camera that captures the economy icon. This is half of the vertical height of the camera's view.
The item who's skins can be used for this item. Usually this is the same ID as the current item.
Should visuals (such as the item skin) be applied when @Shared_Skin_Lookup_ID is a different item.
Maximum amount of items in a stackable item (like a magazine or ammo crate).
Minimum number of items to spawn in a stackable item (like a magazine or ammo crate) when spawning naturally.
Maximum number of items to spawn in a stackable item (like a magazine or ammo crate) when spawning naturally.
Minimum quality/durability level to naturally spawn the item at.
Maximum quality/durability level to naturally spawn the item at.
Which of the player's bone the item will be attached to.
If the item will be attached to the player's left hand instead of their right hand. '@EquipableModelParent LeftHook' should be used instead.
If the model of the item should be mirrored for left handed characters.
If item stats should be automatically added to the description.
Description elements to exclude from the auto-generated item description.
Description elements to include in the auto-generated item description.
If first-person animations should procedurally be given extra inertia to improve low-quality animations.
The type of Useable object to create when this item is equipped.
If players are allowed to equip this item. When set to false only sentries can equip it.
Speed multiplier for how fast the player can move on foot. May get combined with attachments if applicable.
Redirects the @Equip sound to another asset or masterbundle.
Specify the sound played when inspecting this item.
Overrides the item held by the player when equipped.
Overrides the sound the item makes when being manipulated in the inventory.
Specifies which of the primary and secondary slots an item can be placed in.
If the item can be equipped while the player is swimming underwater.
Blueprints defined for this item. Blueprints are crafting recipes that either consume this item or produce this item.
Context menu actions defined for this item.
Actions will be automatically created relevant to the current item, such as repairing, salvaging, and refilling ammo.
Disables the hash verification check between the client and server.
Forces the item quality to be shown on items that usually don't show it.
If this item should be dropped when the player dies.
If this item can be dropped by the player.
If this item should be destroyed when it reaches 0% quality.
If this item should be destroyed when it reaches 0% quality.
Rewards granted when the item reaches zero quality.
If any colliders attached to the @Item prefab should be destroyed when attached to the character (like when it's held).
If any colliders attached to the @Item prefab should be destroyed when attached to the character (like when it's held).
When used on a magazine, deletes the magazine when it runs out of ammo.

Types.Description: Determines which tab the crafting recipe appears under in the inventory.

Values.Description: Blueprint appears under the Tools tab.
Blueprint appears under the Apparel tab.
Blueprint appears under the Supplies tab.
Blueprint appears under the Gears tab.
Blueprint appears under the Ammo tab.
Blueprint appears under the Barricades tab.
Blueprint appears under the Structures tab.
Blueprint appears under the Utilities tab.
Blueprint appears under the Furniture tab.
Blueprint appears under the Repair tab.

Types.Description: Controls what a blueprint does with input items.

Values.Description: No special modification to input items.
Restore target input item to full quality.
Transfer amount from input items to target item.
Sort items with lowest 'amount' to front of list.
Sort items with highest 'amount' to front of list.
Sort items with lowest 'quality' to front of list.
Sort items with highest 'quality' to front of list.
Sum up number of items found, ignoring amount.
Sum up 'amount' of each item, optionally counting zero as one.
No special skills are required.
The 'Crafting' skill is required.
The 'Cooking' skill is required.
The 'Engineer' skill is required.

Properties.Description: The item that is consumed, or 'this' to refer to the current item.
The player has to already have this supply to see the blueprint.
The player has to already have this supply to see the blueprint.
Items with a zero amount like empty magazines are treated as having an amount of 1.
The player has to already have this supply to see the blueprint.
Determines which items are consumed first when fulfilling blueprints.
Determines how the available amount of this input is calculated.
If false, items with an 'amount' greather than or equal to their maximum amount are ignored. Otherwise, they are eligible (default).
If true, items with quality of 100% are eligible (default). Otherwise, they are ignored.
The item that is produced, or 'this' to refer to the current item.
Number of the items refernced by @ID to give the player upon crafting.
Origin of the items given, which determines how full the item is.
Determines which tab this blueprint appears under in the inventory. Use CategoryTags and Operation instead.
Controls what this blueprint does with input items.
Input items defined for this blueprint.
Adds an extra supply that won't be consumed when the item is crafted.
Indicates that this blueprint will only be visible to a player that has @Tool in their inventory.
Output items defined for this blueprint.
Defines a single output item, defaulting to this file's item.
Amount of @Product to give when this blueprint is crafted.
The item origin of @Product, determining how full the item's state is (such as ammo count, water level, etc.).
Reference to an effect that will be spawned when this blueprint is crafted.
The level of @Skill needed to craft this blueprint.
The type of skill needed to craft this blueprint with a level of @Skill_Level.
Transfers special states of some items to the output, like fuel level, gun info, amount, quality, etc.
Prevents attachments from being transferred when @State_Transfer is enabled.
A map name where this blueprint will only be visible on. Ignored if left blank.
Conditions that must be met for this blueprint to be visible and craftable.
Rewards applied after crafting this blueprint.
Used to make this blueprint not visible by search when missing critical items.
Makes this blueprint visible in the crafting menu even when conditions aren't met.
Case-sensitive unique identifier for this blueprint. Used to reference blueprints from other assets or options, such as @(SDG.Unturned.ItemAsset, Assembly-CSharp::Actions).
List of tags that all need to be available nearby to craft this blueprint.
Similar to @RequiresNearbyCraftingTags, but only checked once during level startup. Can test for Level Assets Tags.
Determines which category this blueprint falls under.
If included and @RequiresNearbyCraftingTags is exlcuded, adds the heat tag to @RequiresNearbyCraftingTags.
The default value for the @(SDG.Unturned.BlueprintSupply, Assembly-CSharp::Critical) property of all input items, allowing the use of the shorthand format for critical items.

Values.Description: An action that links to a defined blueprint.

Properties.Description: The type of action to create.
The @(SDG.Unturned.Blueprint, Assembly-CSharp::Name) of the blueprint this action references.
The asset this action's @BlueprintName is on, defaulting to this item.
Pressing this action will take the user to the crafting menu instead of instantly crafting the item.
The key of a pre-existing button name in the PlayerDashboardInventory.dat localization file.
Name of the button in the context menu for this action.
Text displayed when hovering over the button in the context menu for this action.
Index of a blueprint that this action should perform. Better to use @Name instead.
Index of a blueprint that this action should perform. Better to use @Name instead.
Indicates that this action should redirect to the associated blueprint listing in the crafting menu, rather than immediately craft the item.

Values.Description: Item is attached to "Right_Hook", the player's right hand.
Item is attached to "Left_Hook", the player's left hand.
Item is attached to the player's spine.
Item is attached to "Spine_Hook", an optional extra child bone of the player's Spine.
No useable type.
An equippable clothing item that can be changed into by using the item.
An equippable gun with optional attachments.
A consumable food, water, or medical item.
An equippable melee weapon or tool.
An equippable container that stores fuel.
An equippable tool used to move vehicles by hand.
A placeable item that can go on many surfaces including vehicles.
A placeable item that can only go on the ground.
An item that can be thrown such as a grenade.
An equippable item used to speed up the growth of farms, like fertilizer.
An item, such as binoculars, used to see things far away.
An equippable container that stores water.
A fishing rod.
An item that modifies the player's gravity constant when held.
An item that palces a player under arrest, like handcuffs.
An item that releases a player from being under arrest, like a key.
An item that detonates Charge barricades.
An item that is used to refill gasmasks.
An item that can unlock locked cars.
An item used to replace an empty battery in a vehicle.
An item used to replace missing tires on vehicles.
An radio used to voice chat with players from far away.
An equippable item used to more easily place Structures.
An equippable item used to change the primary color of paintable vehicles.
A hat or helmet.
Pants with storage.
A shirt with storage.
A mask that covers the player's face or head.
A backpack or bag with storage.
A vest or overshirt with storage
Glasses or eyewear.
An item that fires bullets or projectiles.
A sight or scope attachment equipped to a gun.
A tactical light, laser, rangefinder, or melee attachment equipped to a gun.
A grip attachment equipped to a gun
A suppressor or barrel attachment equipped to a gun.
An ammo/projectile magazine or clip attachment equipped to a gun.
Consumable food that can be eaten.
Consumable water that can be drank.
Consumable medical supplies that can be used on the player or other players.
An item that can be used as a melee weapon, flashlight, or repair tool.
An item that can store and move fuel.
A generic tool like a lockpick, carjack, housing planner, etc.
A placeable item that can usually be placed anywhere, including vehicles.
A barricade which can store items.
A barricade that can spawn zombies in waves.
A seed that can be planted on ground or special ground obejcts/placeables.
A barricade that acts as a trap that may or may not be explosive.
A placeable item that can not be placed on vehicles.
A basic item that can not be held but may be used in crafting recipes or for other reasons.
A throwable grenade-like item that can explode, emit particles, and/or act as a flashbang.
A fertilizer item that can be used on @FARM barricades.
A item that can be used to zoom in, such as binoculars. Using the item will cause a marker to be placed where the player is looking.
A bottle item used to drink and transport water.
A fishing rod item.
An item that modifies the player's gravity constant when held.
An item that can enable the satellite or chart UI elements.
An item that opens @BOX items from the Steam Marketplace.
An item is opened by @KEY items from the Steam Marketplace.
An item that is used to restrain a player.
An item that is used to release a player that is restrained.
A barricade that can store either fuel or water.
A barricade that produces electricity within a given area.
An item used to detonate explosive charges.
A barricade that is exploded using a @DETONATOR item.
A barricade that stores experience.
An item that keeps a radiation-proof @MASK item working while the player is in a radiated zone.
A storage barricade that fires on other players using it's equipped gun.
Items that repair vehicles, currently just batteries.
An item that can replace missing tires on vehicles.
An item that can enable the compass UI element.
An item that can gradually pump fuel from the ground.
An item that can paint vehicles a specific color.
There is no vision effect, and normal lighting is used.
Military nightvision lighting is used. Nightvision color is #147850, and nightvision fog intensity is 0.25.
Civilian nightvision lighting is used. Nightvision color is #666666, and nightvision fog intensity is 0.5.
Headlamp lighting is used. This will enable a toggleable light source and allow for using PlayerSpotLightConfig properties.
Stun behaviour is determined by damage dealt (greater than 20 damage for normal zombies will stun them).
Zombies will never get stunned by this weapon.
Zombies will always get stunned by this weapon.
The Bleeding status effect will only be applied if the necessary damage threshold is met.
The Bleeding status effect will always be applied on hit.
The Bleeding status effect is never applied by this weapon.
Anyone hit by the weapon will have their Bleeding status effect removed.
The Broken Bones status effect is never applied by this weapon.
The Broken Bones status effect will always be applied on hit.
Anyone hit by the weapon will have their Broken Bones status effect removed.
Do not add any of the newer info to the description. Equivalent to setting @Use_Auto_Stat_Descriptions to false.
Include names of gun's attachments in the description.
Include any other info without its own flag.
Add as much info to the description as possible. Equivalent to setting @Use_Auto_Stat_Descriptions to true.

BundleAssets.Description: Sound played when the item is equipped.
Contains all animations relavent to the item.
The object used for the dropped item, as well as the held item unless @EquipablePrefab is set. This is not required for shirts or pants.
